answers.answer: I had it :) it came out negative. But my best friend had diabetes during her pregnacy and her baby was absolutely fine. She had to take some tablets whilst she was pregnant but she had a normal pregnancy. Hope this helps you xx

I've had to have the glucose test done 3 times, I'm 37 weeks now, sometimes it comes out negative due to what you've eaten prior to the test,worst case scenario, you'll have to monitor your sugar level,but you and baby will be fine,don't stress

Under 140 is passing for the one hour and you have to take the three hour. Anything over 200 and you dont have to take the three because it means you have gestational diabetes and have to be put on monitoring and diet control. I took ot at 12 weeks and 25 weeks (early because I am high risk) and passed both.
I took mines today and now Waiting on my results to come back, I'm super nervous!!!

I took it twice and both times I failed.  I have gestational diabetes and I have to check my sugar levels 4x a day. Its really not so bad I just watch what I eat and do moderate exercise.  So far my pregnancy has been pretty smooth me and baby are perfectly healthy :)
I have had diabetes since I was 4yrs old now I'm 20 and my due date is feb24th its not that bad dealing with diabetes

question: Who has taken the glucose diabetes test? How did it go? I'm kinda nervous what if I do come out positive for it . Did your pregnancy still continue normal and did ur baby have any complications ? Has anything changed
title: glucose test
